intro: Psychotria hawaiiensis var. glomerata, commonly known as the Hawaiian Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This variety is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale green flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
